titleStmt.title: R. C. Wood to Thomas E. Bramlette
CWG1547

availability.p: This image and transcription is publicly accessible. The image appears courtesy of the repository named in the Source Description. The transcription and annotation were undertaken by Kentucky Historical Society staff, volunteers, and interns. If referencing this document title, accession number, and permanent URL.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition
Early Access

msIdentifier.repository: Kentucky Department for Libraries and Archives
msIdentifier.collection: Office of the Governor, Thomas E. Bramlette: Governor's Official Correspondence File, Military Correspondence, 1863-1867

body.p:
Assistant Surgeon Generals Office,
Louisville, Ky.
Decr 12 1863.
Sir
I have to acknowledge the receipt of your letter of the 9th inst. requesting me to authorize the transfer of Kentucky Soldiers from the Hospitals in St Louis to Louisville.
A copy of the inspections to Surgeon Mills, Medical Director Dept. of the Missouri in conformity with your desire, is enclosed for your information.

I have the honor to be,
Very respectfully,
Your obedient Servant,
R.C. Wood
Asst Surgeon General
U. S. Army.

His Excellency,
T. E. Bramlette
Governor of Kentucky,
Frankfort, Ky.

Asst Surgeon General's Office
Louisville Ky. Decr 12th 1863
Col. R. C. Wood
Asst Surgeon General
U. S. Army.
Relative to transfer of Kentucky sick from St Louis to Louisville Ky.
